TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SKPath extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

summary.para: Same as but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour.

remarks.para: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

MemberSignature.Value: public SKPath ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an empty path.

MemberSignature.Value: public SKPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath path);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class SkiaSharp.SKPath path) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to clone.
Docs.summary: Creates an SKPath by making a copy of an existing path
Docs.remarks: This constructor can throw InvalidOperationException if there is a problem copying the source path.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddArc (SkiaSharp.SKRect oval, float startAngle, float sweepAngle);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddArc(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect oval, float32 startAngle, float32 sweepAngle) cil managed

Docs.param: The bounds of oval used to define the size of the arc.
Starting angle (in degrees) where the arc begins.
Sweep angle (in degrees) measured clockwise.
Docs.summary: Add the specified arc to the path as a new contour.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddOval (SkiaSharp.SKRect rect, SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection direction);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddOval(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect rect, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection direction) cil managed

Docs.param: The bounding oval to add as a closed contour to the path
The direction to wind the oval's contour.
Docs.summary: Adds an oval to the current path.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath other, SkiaSharp.SKPath.AddMode mode);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddPath(class SkiaSharp.SKPath other, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPath/AddMode mode) cil managed

Docs.param: The path containing the elements to be added to the current path.

Determines how the path contours are added to the path. On Append mode, contours are added as new contours. On Extend mode, the last contour of the path is extended with the first contour of the path.
Docs.summary: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path, using the specified extension mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath other, ref SkiaSharp.SKMatrix matrix, SkiaSharp.SKPath.AddMode mode);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddPath(class SkiaSharp.SKPath other, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKMatrix matrix, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPath/AddMode mode) cil managed

Docs.param: The path containing the elements to be added to the current path.
Transformation applied to the path.

Determines how the path contours are added to the path. On Append mode, contours are added as new contours. On Extend mode, the last contour of the path is extended with the first contour of the path.
Docs.summary: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path, by applying the specified transformation matrix, using the specified extension mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddPath (SkiaSharp.SKPath other, float dx, float dy, SkiaSharp.SKPath.AddMode mode);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddPath(class SkiaSharp.SKPath other, float32 dx, float32 dy, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPath/AddMode mode) cil managed

Docs.param: The path containing the elements to be added to the current path.
The amount to translate the path in X as it is added.
The amount to translate the path in Y as it is added.

Determines how the path contours are added to the path. On Append mode, contours are added as new contours. On Extend mode, the last contour of the path is extended with the first contour of the path.
Docs.summary: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path offset by (, ), using the specified extension mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddPathReverse (SkiaSharp.SKPath other);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddPathReverse(class SkiaSharp.SKPath other) cil managed

Docs.param: The path containing the elements to be added to the current path.
Docs.summary: Extends the current path with the path elements from another path in reverse.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddRect (SkiaSharp.SKRect rect, SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection direction);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddRect(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect rect, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection direction) cil managed

Docs.param: The rectangle to add as a closed contour to the path
The direction to wind the rectangle's contour.
Docs.summary: Add a closed rectangle contour to the path.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddRect (SkiaSharp.SKRect rect, SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection direction, uint startIndex);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddRect(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect rect, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPathDirection direction, unsigned int32 startIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The rectangle to add as a closed contour to the path
The direction to wind the rectangle's contour.
Initial point of the contour (initial moveTo), expressed as a corner index, starting in the upper-left position, clock-wise. Must be 0-3.
Docs.summary: Add a closed rectangle contour to the path.
Docs.remarks: Add a closed rectangle contour to the path with an initial point of the contour (startIndex) expressed as a corner index.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Close ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Closes the current contour.

remarks.para: If the current point is not equal to the first point of the contour, a line segment is automatically added.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ConicTo (float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float w);
.method public hidebysig instance void ConicTo(float32 x0, float32 y0, float32 x1, float32 y1, float32 w) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the control point of the conic curve.
The y-coordinate of the control point of the conic curve.
The x-coordinate of the end point of the conic curve.
The y-coordinate of the end point of the conic curve.
The weight of the conic curve.
Docs.summary: Add a conic path from the last point.

remarks.para: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPath.Iterator CreateIterator (bool forceClose);
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKPath/Iterator CreateIterator(bool forceClose) cil managed

param.name: forceClose
param.para: When this is true, each contour (as defined by a new starting move command) will be completed with a close verb regardless of the contour's contents.

Docs.summary: Creates an iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
Docs.returns: An object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.

remarks.para: This iterator is able to clean up the path as the values are returned. If you do not desire to get verbs that have been cleaned up, use the method instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPath.RawIterator CreateRawIterator ();
.method public hidebysig instance class SkiaSharp.SKPath/RawIterator CreateRawIterator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a raw iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
Docs.returns: An object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.
Docs.remarks: Unlike the method, this iterator does not clean up or normalize the values in the path. It returns the raw elements contained in the path.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CubicTo (float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2);
.method public hidebysig instance void CubicTo(float32 x0, float32 y0, float32 x1, float32 y1, float32 x2, float32 y2) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the 1st control point on a cubic curve
The y-coordinate of the 1st control point on a cubic curve
The x-coordinate of the 2nd control point on a cubic curve
The y-coordinate of the 2nd control point on a cubic curve
The x-coordinate of the end point on a cubic curve
The y-coordinate of the end point on a cubic curve
Docs.summary: Add a cubic bezier from the last point

remarks.para: Add a cubic bezier from the last point, approaching control points (x0,y0) and (x1,y1), and ending at (x2,y2).
If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPathFillType FillType { set; get; }
.property instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPathFillType FillType

Docs.summary: The path's fill type.

remarks.para: This is used to define how "inside" is computed. The default value is SKPathFillType.Winding.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetBounds (out SkiaSharp.SKRect rect);
.method public hidebysig instance bool GetBounds(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect rect) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the bounds of the path's points.

returns.para: If the path contains zero points/verbs, this will return the "empty" rect [0, 0, 0, 0].

remarks.para: Note: this bounds may be larger than the actual shape, since curves do not extend as far as their control points. Additionally this bound encompases all points, even isolated moveTos either preceeding or following the last non-degenerate contour.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LineTo (float x, float y);
.method public hidebysig instance void LineTo(float32 x, float32 y) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the end of a line
The y-coordinate of the end of a line
Docs.summary: Add a line from the last point to the specified point (x,y).

remarks.para: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

MemberSignature.Value: public void MoveTo (float x, float y);
.method public hidebysig instance void MoveTo(float32 x, float32 y) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the start of a new contour
The y-coordinate of the start of a new contour
Docs.summary: Set the beginning of the next contour to the point.

MemberSignature.Value: public void QuadTo (float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1);
.method public hidebysig instance void QuadTo(float32 x0, float32 y0, float32 x1, float32 y1) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve
The y-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve
The x-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve
The y-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve
Docs.summary: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point.

remarks.para: Add a quadratic bezier from the last point, approaching control point (x0,y0), and ending at (x1,y1). If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the control point of the conic curve.
The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the end point of the conic curve.
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the end point of the conic curve.
The weight of the conic curve.

summary.para: Same as but the coordinates are considered relative to the last point on this contour.

remarks.para: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).

The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the 1st control point on a cubic curve.
The amount to add to the x-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the 2nd control point on a cubic curve.
The amount to add to the y-coordinate of the last point on this contour, to specify the 2nd control point on a cubic curve.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Reset ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.

remarks.para: This frees up internal storage associated with those segments.
On Android, does not change fSourcePath.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Rewind ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Rewind() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.

remarks.para: However, any internal storage for those lines/curves is retained, making reuse of the path potentially faster.
On Android, does not change fSourcePath.

Docs.remarks: If no call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0,0).
